title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: The revert operation in the java editor is significantly slower compared to the close and reopen operation.
OB: When performing the following steps: 1) Opening an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 2) Selecting the end of the first line and adding a space character to mark the file as dirty. It takes about 8 seconds to: - Click on the close box in the editor tab. - Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog. - Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
SR: 1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 2) Modify the end of the first line by adding a space character to mark the file as dirty. 3) Wait for approximately 8 seconds. 4) Click on the close box in the editor tab. 5) Select 'no' when prompted to save changes. 6) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 7) Observe that the file successfully reopens with the original contents. 8) Repeat steps 1) and 2). 9) Wait for approximately 15 seconds. 10) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. 11) Observe that it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
